--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "yecheal" <yecheal@...> wrote:
>
> Thi=
s tsuba was recently sold for JPY 71,000.
> Does this mean it is an origina=
l? Is this the avarage value?
>

It certainly means someone thought it was,=
 but that doesn't mean much.
 I have seen known repos go for alot.  Most of=
 us have (most of us
have also been the one to bid high as well at one poin=
t or another) I
don't follow that particular style so pricing isn't somethi=
ng I will
comment on.  The one thing I am learning is that there were a lot=
 of
"copies" made in the early 1800's, so they are old in one respect, but
=
they aren't the real deal.  Then there all the copies made in the late
1800=
's that were more for the international/tourist markets. I don't
have a tea=
cher and have been blowing my opportunities to be with other
collectors.  I=
 was so excited joining the NY token kai with access to
many knowledgeable =
people.  But between my health issues and my kids
usually visiting me the w=
eekend the club meets has put a huge damper
on me being able to go.  I was =
picking up things here and there though
and it all goes back to the iron or=
 base metals used.  You start to
recognize the metal from the 1800's which =
is trying to imitate but
usually it is a bit overdone.  I wish I could spen=
d more time with
knowledgeable folks.  I have to make my way back to the to=
ken kai. 
Pricing by the way is something that I have struggled with since =
the
beginning.  I think it just takes time to get an idea of where a piece
=
price range falls into.  This is not an exact science by any means. 
And un=
fortunately, the advice I was given on what it's worth hold
true, " it is w=
orth whatever someone else is willing to pay for it". 
Not a lot of practic=
al help.  So much too learn.  Good luck and just
keep plugging at it.  As J=
im Gilbert says just keep on looking at
them, after feeling and studying ov=
er 10,000 you will start to get an
idea.  Don't let that number discourage =
you, just keep at it.  Best of
 luck and remember the most important thing =
about collecting sword
fittings, Send all Praying Mantis themed fittings to=
 me. LOL.
Thanks,
Ken aka "the mantis dude"
